Crash Into Me.title: Crash Into Me
Crash Into Me.description:
The mysterious, oft-romantic and a little creepy “Crash Into Me” is the third single off of the album Crash and one of the Dave Matthews Band’s most popular songs of all time. In the years since its release, it has become noteworthy for its continuing popularity, despite being as many describe it, “schlocky and largely irredeemable.”

While often remembered as “a sexy ballad, full of both sorrow and dread, all about pining over someone from afar”, and a popular choice for slow dance music at proms and such, the song actually has a creepier meaning upon close inspection. As Dave alludes to during a 1999 appearance on the VH1 show Storytellers, the song is about the worship of women, and more specifically about a stalker/peeping tom/voyeur type:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eW25UqwlRsk

“Crash Into Me” has also been used in different media, including on the TV show The Office, and notably as an emotional lynchpin in the 2017 movie Lady Bird.

Ants Marching.title: Ants Marching
Ants Marching.description:
This song appeared on Dave Matthews Band’s 1994 album Under the Table and Dreaming.

It was the band’s second single from the album and has grown into the band’s signature song. Numerous dedicated DMB fans refer to themselves as “Ants” because of the track and it also inspired the name of one of its most popular fansites, Antsmarching.org.

According to Wikipedia, the song has been played at their live shows more than any other, and Dave Matthews has called it their “anthem.”

The video, released in 1995, was filmed in New York City.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MNgJBIx-hK8

#41.description:
Written about a falling out with an old manager, the track is mainly focused around a saxophone solo following the end of the third verse.

The studio version segues into the next song on the record, “Say Goodbye”, a transition the band has repeated several times in a live setting.

Given its name because, according to Matthews, it was the 41st song written for the band. They never came up with a better title, so this one stuck, echoing a trend from “#34”.

Grey Street.title: Grey Street
Grey Street.description:
The third and final single from Busted Stuff, the second track off the album and fan favorite at shows.

The original version off The Lillywhite Sessions features added choruses with a bit of a different theme.

At live shows the song usually only has two verses, and two choruses with a jam after.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7O9Sf4P38oE

Samurai Cop (Oh Joy Begin).title: Samurai Cop (Oh Joy Begin)
Samurai Cop (Oh Joy Begin).description:
“Samurai Cop (Oh Joy Begin)” is the lead single from the Dave Matthews Band’s album Come Tomorrow.

The song originally debuted live in 2016 and is based off the notoriously bad movie Samurai Cop. The band shared the single officially on May 10, 2018:

https://twitter.com/davematthewsbnd/status/994552824410320898?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

Satellite.title: Satellite
Satellite.description:
The fifth and final single from 1994’s Under the Table and Dreaming, it stretched into the top 20 on Billboard’s Alternative Songs chart.

The music video was the third and final for an Under the Table song and features actor Johnny Galecki of “Roseanne” and “The Big Bang Theory” fame.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GAamgBPebsk

The Space Between.title: The Space Between
The Space Between.description:
The second single from the album Everyday and one of DMB’s highest-charting singles to date.

The song details two people who cannot be together, but still yearn to be.

Tripping Billies.title: Tripping Billies
Tripping Billies.description:
Via MTV:


“Tripping Billies,” Matthews said, took its name from an episode years ago when he took acid on a South African beach. No sooner had he taken it than he decided he didn’t want to trip.

“But the acid said, ‘Too late!,’ ” Matthews said. Over the next few hours, he saw his girlfriend’s face turn into his mother’s, watched his hand melt and somehow lost his clothes.


The title is reportedly a reference to a comment once made to Matthews that his band sounds like “a bunch of hillbillies tripping on acid.”

Jimi Thing.title: Jimi Thing
Jimi Thing.description:
The song is about altered states of consciousness brought about by the use of chemical substances, particularly how they aren’t always a bad thing, as other DMB songs might suggest.

Via MTV:

“A Jimi thing in some places is a condom,” Matthews said. But for him, he said, it was a temporary song title that stuck. “It was kind of reminiscent of the early days of Jimi Hendrix, and we didn’t have any names for any of the songs, so we called it the ‘Jimi thing.’ ”

The song was released as a single from Under the Table and Dreaming.

You and Me.title: You and Me
You and Me.album: Big Whiskey and The GrooGrux King
You and Me.description:
The third and final single from Big Whiskey and the GrooGrux King, looking at a romantic couple and the adventures they’ll face over the course of a lifetime and beyond.

The band performed the song as part of the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards in 2010 (below), when the group was nominated for Album of the Year.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6t78OW-yhM

Grace Is Gone.title: Grace Is Gone
Grace Is Gone.description:
“Grace is Gone” is a song about losing ones “grace” in God… not a girl named Grace. Dave wrote it around the time his stepfather died. Finding it difficult to write a song about a stepfather, he came up with “Grace”. People connect to the song so well because it can make the listener feel the loss of a loved one or something that they loved.

The jazzy, country style gives this ballad the power to make you feel the pain in Dave’s somber vocals. Throw in a groovy interplay between an elastic bass and some rolling drums and you have the true spirit of DMB.

Christmas Song.title: Christmas Song
Christmas Song.description:
Via MTV:

“Christmas Song” came to Matthews after reading a quote by the Irish writer Oscar Wilde: “If Christ was alive now, the one thing he wouldn’t be is a Christian.” Some fans groaned at that, to which Matthews responded, “Hey, I didn’t say it; Oscar Wilde said it.”

Bartender.title: Bartender
Bartender.description:
Eleventh track off the long awaited Busted Stuff and a carry over from The Lillywhite Sessions. Matthews has commented that he likes to think of a bartender as a figure of God that you confess to get absolution.

Bartender is also known as the late LeRoi Moore’s favorite song and it was the first song preformed live after his death.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MF7T1QNVH-Y

Cry Freedom.title: Cry Freedom
Cry Freedom.description: Influenced by Steven Biko, leader of the Black Consciousness Movement in South Africa in the 1970s, Dave Matthews' birth nation. Although the song is among the band’s first played, it was released after the fall of apartheid, a system of racial segregation in South Africa.

What Would You Say.title: What Would You Say
What Would You Say.description:
The band’s debut single with RCA and the one that set it on the road to widespread success. With a guest appearance by Blues Traveler frontman John Popper and a quirky music video, DMB distinguished itself as something different from its contemporaries right out of the gate.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7gXuYFih6Y8

According to fansite Antsmarching.org, the song is about living for the moment.
